p: After learning Java, I really wanted to dive into game development. I had a longstanding desire to recreate some of the games I enjoyed while I was growing up. I located a few courses on Udemy and Coursera that would teach me the frameworks for Monogame and Unity. Both platforms were driven by C#.

Upon discovering this, I did some research into what C# was like. I learned quickly that it was basically Microsoft's version of Java. Having worked with Java in some projects, I felt that this would be an easy transition and with the aid of these courses, I was able to quickly get rolling within both of these frameworks.

Note: If any of the Unity projects have link to the game, they will not work in Chrome. This is because Chrome has disabled NPAPI as of April 2015. At the time of writing this, Firefox still let's you play the games.

unordered_list: Coursera - Beginning Game Programming with C# - Link to Course
Udemy - The Complete Unity Developer - Link to Course
